intro: Aureolaria skinneriana var. asperula, commonly known as the roughleaf goldenrod, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its yellow, composite flower heads that bloom in late summer. The plant has narrow, rough-textured leaves that are typically alternate along the stem. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an important species for pollinators and ecological studies.
